verbs.description: discommend (third-person singular simple present discommends, present participle discommending, simple past and past participle discommended)

entries.meaning: (now rare) To show disapproval of something, find fault with.
(now rare) To speak dissuasively of, to advise against.
examples: Savonarola discommends goat's flesh, and so doth Bruerinus […], calling it a filthy beast, and rammish […].
